page.title: 12THE "OO" RAILWAY, EXMOUTH
page.content: The "00" railway was begun in 1956 by Gerry Nicholson. It took 14 years to build. It opened in 1970. It was only a small track at the time. Now there are 7,500ft of track. The track is being extended outside around a dock. The dock is an attractive pool with chinese fish in it. If it rains, the trains will just turn around in the porch and go back inside the building. 20 trains can run on the track at any one time. The fastest train was damaged before it could go on the track. The trains range from steam to diesel but all the other trains can outrun the "intercity 125." When 3 trains were racing around the track at 3 or 4 M.P.H they look very fast. I thought they would crash. Instead they intermeshed, seperated and raced in different directions. I think it is a good place to take children.
